comment: Smooth and sweet to the palate, never had a French whiskey and I don't regret it.
Absolutely the best for drinking near. Flavorful, refreshing and with a good bit of a spice. It'll be like nothing else, and carries closer to a cognac than a typical whiskey.
Lots of vanilla and some smoke on the nose. Mouth feel is spice and floral in the mouth. The fruit will creep through and linger. Interesting and satisfying pour
Too sweet for my liking, closer to a brandy than a whiskey. I recommend mixing, it makes delightful and unique cocktails.

Not sure if I should give this to my wife as a perfume, or drink it.  The nose is quite floral, almost like roses and cotton candy. I keep coming back for the aroma.  Taste is so-so....but I really love this scent.  Really a different style.  I think it's perfect for summer actually---not sure I'd want to be sipping a peaty Lagavulin in 90 degrees, but this I don't mind.  Alison Patel's creation is definitely unique.

What an unusual whiskey! If you're looking for something for its sheer originality, this one's definitely it. My first impression was of a strawberry dessert wine: sweet. Too sweet. And while I really enjoy a nose that is reminiscent of strawberry pie, its one-dimensional aspect is just too much for me. The palate has a touch of wood, and a spice that is pretty indiscernible to my tongue (and not great), with a body that feels a little flat and a lot underproofed. Towards the finish, there's a bizarre deviation where the sweetness gives way to bitterness only to then end on a very short note. Strange but worth trying.

This is the definition of a dessert whisky. 

Nose: Stone fruits, peaches and apricots, a subtle cinnamon tantalizes the back of your throat, a bit of raspberry, a bit of a creamy note and a touch of dark chocolate. It smells divine. 

Pallet: Sweetness envelops, as the spice begins to rise. Fresh peaches rolled in cinnamon, oak begins to show if held on the pallet for a decent time. Watery mouth-feel. Finish: Short to Medium. Dark chocolate and oak, no fruit on the finish.

Nose part 2: If you go back to it the chocolate note comes to the front with a stronger raspberry note. 

I have had this bottle for a while and the spice has really come up after about 1/4 of the bottle was finished. On a fresh open it was pure fruit and chocolate. Because of this I gave it 3 stars. It is good, but the way it has changed so drastically makes it a open and finish quickly.
Sweet, but not in a good way.
I've never liked banana-flavored things that aren't actual bananas, and this conjurs up those little banana Runts candies. Lots of tropical fruits and sweetness. Overall much too sweet for me.
Sweet. Banana, hint of strawberry, a little overly sweet for my taste. A nice desert drink after a good meal
loved the mellow taste - thought I detected vanilla overtones
Love this one. It's a regular due to the price. I have a bottle I got as a gift 3 years ago that I've been nursing. Love the smooth and mildly sweet taste

Strawberry extract, vanilla frosting, young cognac, licorice and a floral note I can't quite distinguish.  Unfortunately, these flavors do not mesh well for my palate, and the sweetness level of this whisky is generally off the charts. Diabetics be warned.

A very different whisky ! Lots of vanilla and fruity Flavours. Nose is pleasant. Can tell it's young but love the fact it's different yet still has whisky characters. My Wife would love it but I can't find any outlets that sell in Singapore or Australia.
Smooth, but am I really tasting artificial banana taffy?
Fruity and slightly sweet but with a deeper amber color
This is my go to, and unlike scotches its sweetness expands when extremely chilled or gently accented with water.
This is an unusually floral whisky. I am still deciding if I like it. I love the uniqueness of it though
You can really taste the cognac barrel ageing. This whisky is  sweet like candy.
Strong taste but smoother than anticipated.

what the hell is going on? nose of sugary sweetness. almost cloying. like grape otter pops.

thin on the tongue. tea-like. medicinal cherry and cotton candy.
Smooth edges with a definite sweet, silky, sherry finish. Good for a glass when you want that sweetness

I owe this one at least four stars if just for the originality - I'm not a newcomer to the world of whisky by any means, but I've never encountered one like this before. The nose immediately conjured up those orange Circus Peanuts marshmallow candies. A bit more nosing about in the sweet shop turns up sweet orange, coconut cream pie, marshmallow, vanilla fudge, Sauternes wine, and maybe honey candies. The palate, deceptively, opens up with a deeply savory (almost mushroomy) maltiness, but gives way to marshmallow, candied orange peel, vanilla cream, and a pinch of cinnamon. Still trying to wrap my mind around this one, but it's certainly tasty. I wish it were bottled at a higher ABV, though - it does seem a bit watery at 40%.

I love the story behind this whisky, and because of that, this whiskey makes sense. A fruity floral nose, it has pronounced flavors of banana Laffy Taffy and pastry and a little heat from youth. It is a fun whisky, not my favorite, but lots of fun.

Neat: Love the candy (almost Smarties candy like) nose. This whisky benefits from a small glass that helps concentrate the smell. A wine glass like glass can present a smell of over ripened bananas. Power sugar flavor (again like Smarties candy). Light sweet finish with a touch of vanilla/oak. Light powered sugar finish.
Banana cream with some subtle date-like sweetness. Love the cognac finish for a very fun ride. One of my top finds for 2018
Nice licorice flavor that is very subtle.

Vanilla, anise, and smooth sweetness.

Eileen: “nope, I’m out.”
Caramel apple upfront, and a sweet, smooth finish. Not my stereotypical idea of a whiskey, but it sure is tasty!
Very unexpected, banana on the nose. Very in-whisky like, many whisky drinkers with me did not like it, but I really did.
tastes like a hard candy I had when I was a kid, but not the good kind
Extremely fruity. Strong pineapple and vanilla.
Very floral with lavendar tones. Also vanilla. Moderate spicy build up. Very unusual and enjoyable.
Jam and fruits on the nose. Red licorice and mango on the palate. A little pepper and chocolate in the finish.
Heel zoet aroma met een gelijkaardig palet op de tong. Een toegankelijke whisky zonder finish.
Like the kind of Halloween candy you'd eat last
Floral nose, with hints of coconut and licorice candies. Very sweet taste with the same fruity floral notes. Lots of candy taste

very light, nose gives nothing away

palate: quite sweet, like a candy I can't quite put finger on
Distinct notes of bubble gum.  Very interesting.
Very floral nose. Nice and sweet vanilla finish. Zero bite. Smooth and good to pair with a dessert
Super floral and vanilla on the nose; continuing to the palate; quick finish
Wow. Lots of floral, citrusy, and vanilla flavors with a brilliant vanilla finish. New York (owner), UK (Single Malt), France (Cognac Casks)
[Whiskey Live NY 2018] - Not sure why I found this to be second best in show (Behind Lore).  Might be the surprising blast of blueberry pancakes.  This is my next bottle to get for sure!
nice sweet taste, banana, caramel, touch of perfume.
nose is caramel and banana. taste is sticky bananas foster, a little hot, and banana bread.
Pleasant notes of yeast and blueberry muffins.
Blueberries and smooth finish. Amazing - keep’em comin....
Sweet, vanilla. Smooth, tasted different to a usual Whisky really enjoyed it. Cuvee Speciale (different label to what is shown)

Bananas on the nose, not typical bananas but a banana flavored candy. There's a very specific swedish candy called ''skumbanan'' and that's pretty much what I'm getting from it. The taste is more of the same, takes me back to when I was a kid eating these overly sweet banana flavored candies. Also red grapes and oak spice in there. Ripe pears on the finish. 

Definitely not your usual whisky flavors in there, but I really enjoy it for what it is. A really nice and unusual dessert whisky.
Extremely l that dessert whisky with a wonderfully light and fruity aftertaste. Extremely non traditional in flavor but a pleasant change nonetheless.

Wow! This is really interesting, and frankly pretty special. Seems sweet on the nose, lots of banana and caramel, but don't be fooled - the juice is really delightful. Honestly, it's the first whisky I've tried in a long time that made me smile. It's just fun. Brought it to a house party the other night and it was the first bottle gone!

(Pro tip: I've taken to using it for old fashioneds and cutting back on the sugar.)
really 3.5.  much better than the last time.  bubble gum.  this is a very unique whiskey

3.75 stars

The most intruing mix of whisky, cognac, and amaretto as nose and flavor elements.  The price is enough to make you pause, but in my opinion, worth it.
light brown colour. super ripe bananas on the nose . strong oily taste . overall a lot of fun

It's light and a little harsh with a lot of floral. There's a bitter flavor and quite a bit of alcohol. There's tons of bubblegum flavor and some strawberry gummies. It's interesting with a fair amount going on, but it tastes young and wrong. It's not terrible, but it tastes more like a low quality brandy.
Smells slightly floral and sweet- almost coconut. Taste is smooth, sweet, and warm. Good with dessert
Sweet and vanilla on the nose. Lovely sweet, vanilla flavor with a hint of bitterness at the back of the throat. Mild, pleasant aftertaste.

Well if you like creaming soda this is right up your alley..blargh this is one of the weirdest whiskies I'd ever tried. If you asked me to guess what it was I'd say it's like someone got base ethanol and added artificial candy like flavour..how is this so highly rated???
Cream and vanilla galore at first, with a big kick of spice at the end. A bit discordant but nevertheless tasty.
